1.author: Sloan Wilson
1.desc: Success in almost any field depends more on energy and drive than it does on intelligence. This explains why we have so many stupid leaders.

2.author: MH Alderson
2.desc: If at first you don't succeed; you are running about average.

3.author: Boris Yeltsin
3.desc: You can build a throne with bayonets, but you can't sit on it for long.

4.author: David Letterman
4.desc: There's no business like show business, but there are several businesses like accounting.

5.author: Will Rogers
5.desc: Even if you are on the right track, You'll get run over if you just sit there.

6.author: J. Paul Gettyk
6.desc: If you owe the bank $100 that's your problem. If you owe the bank $100 million, that's the bank's problem.

7.author: Sr. Thomas Watson
7.desc: To be successful, you have to have your heart in your business, and your business in your heart.

8.author: Robert Half
8.desc: Delegating work works, provided the one delegating works, too.

9.author: Samuel Goldwyn
9.desc: I don't want yes-men around me. I want everyone to tell the truth, even if it costs them their jobs.

10.author: Unknown
10.desc: Every accomplishment starts with a decision to try.

11.author: Karl Marx
11.desc: Catch a man a fish, and you can sell it to him. Teach a man to fish, and you ruin a wonderful business opportunity.

12.author: Dr. Henry Link
12.desc: We generate fears while we sit. We over come them by action. Fear is natures way of warning us to get busy.

13.author: Peter Drucker
13.desc: There's an enormous number of managers who have retired on the job.

14.author: Lewis Black
14.desc: You don't want another Enron? Here's your law: If a company, can't explain, in ONE SENTENCE...what it does...it's illegal.

15.author: Coco Chanel
15.desc: Success is often achieved by those who don't know that failure is inevitable.

16.author: A Bug's Life
16.desc: First rule of leadership: everything is your fault.

17.author: Roy L. Smith
17.desc: The successful man is the one who finds out what is the matter with his business before his competitors do.

18.author: Stephen Butler Leacock
18.desc: Advertising may be described as the science of arresting the human intelligence long enough to get money from it.

19.author: Doug Larson
19.desc: Accomplishing the impossible means only the boss will add it to your regular duties.

20.author: Unknown
20.desc: The true entrepreneur is a doer, not a dreamer.

21.author: Lewis Grizzard
21.desc: Life is like a dogsled team. If you ain't the lead dog, the scenery never changes.

22.author: Albert Einstein
22.desc: Everything should be made as simple as possible, but not simpler.

23.author: Ted Turner
23.desc: My son is now an 'entrepreneur'. That's what you're called when you don't have a job.

24.author: Casey Stengel
24.desc: The key to being a good manager is keeping the people who hate you away from those who are still undecided.

25.author: Gary Vaynerchuck
25.desc: Please think about your legacy, because you're writing it every day.

26.author: William Feather
26.desc: A budget tells us what we can't afford, but it doesn't keep us from buying it.

27.author: Seth Godin
27.desc: There's no shortage of remarkable ideas, what's missing is the will to execute them.

28.author: Margaret Thatcher
28.desc: Being powerful is like being a lady. If you have to tell people you are, you aren't.

29.author: Benjamin Franklin
29.desc: If you would like to know the value of money, try to borrow some.

30.author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goeth
30.desc: To think is easy. To act is difficult. To act as one thinks is the most difficult.

31.author: Henry Ford
31.desc: The question, 'Who ought to be boss?' is like asking, 'Who ought to be the tenor in the quartet?' Obviously, the man who can sing tenor.

32.author: Richard Branson
32.desc: Business opportunities are like buses, there's always another one coming.

33.author: Ambrose Bierce
33.desc: Corporation: An ingenious device for obtaining profit without individual responsibility.

34.author: George S. Patton
34.desc: Don't tell people how to do things, tell them what to do and let them surprise you with their results.

35.author: John Naisbitt
35.desc: The new source of power is not money in the hands of a few, but information in the hands of many.

36.author: Andrew Young
36.desc: Nothing is illegal if a hundred businessmen decide to do it, and that's true anywhere in the world.

37.author: Unknown
37.desc: A meeting is an event at which the minutes are kept and the hours are lost.

38.author: William Wordsworth
38.desc: In modern business it is not the crook who is to be feared most, it is the honest man who doesn't know what he is doing.

39.author: General Douglas MacArthur
39.desc: There is no security on the earth, there is only opportunity.

40.author: Bill Gates
40.desc: Your most unhappy customers are your greatest source of learning.

41.author: Bette Midler
41.desc: The worst part of success is to try to find someone who is happy for you.

42.author: Norman Schwarzkopf
42.desc: Leadership is a potent combination of strategy and character. But if you must be without one, be without the strategy.
